sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The comical history of Don Quixote as it is acted at the Queens Theatre in Dorset-Garden, by Their Majesties servants / written by Mr. D'Urfey. Don Quixote D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723. Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de, 1547-1616. Don Quixote. Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695. Don Quixote.
3 v.
Printed for Samuel Briscoe ..., London : 1694-1696.
Each part has special t.p.; pt. 2 has imprint: London : Printed for S. Briscoe and H. Neuman, 1694; pt. 3 has title: The comical history of Don Quixote ... with the marriage of Mary the Buxome ... 1696. Without the music, by "the most eminent masters of the age", pt. 3 "being the last piece set to musick by the late famous Mr. Purcell". Cf. Sonneck, O.G.T. Librettos; Woodward & McManaway, 503-504. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
=======
The comical history of Don Quixote as it is acted at the Queens Theatre in Dorset-Garden, by Their Majesties servants / written by Mr. D'Urfey. Don Quixote D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723. Cervantes Saavedra, Miguel de, 1547-1616. Don Quixote. Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695. Don Quixote.
3 v.
Printed for Samuel Briscoe ..., London : 1694-1696.
Each part has special t.p.; pt. 2 has imprint: London : Printed for S. Briscoe and H. Neuman, 1694; pt. 3 has title: The comical history of Don Quixote ... with the marriage of Mary the Buxome ... 1696. Without the music, by "the most eminent masters of the age", pt. 3 "being the last piece set to musick by the late famous Mr. Purcell". Cf. Sonneck, O.G.T. Librettos; Woodward & McManaway, 503-504. Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
Samuel Briscoe
